intro: Cleanthes othonnoides, commonly known as the Sierra goldfields, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and clusters of small flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and meadows, and is adapted to arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural surroundings. The species is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
